div.div: Buying all 175,223,510 possible lottery tickets isn’t the worst idea you’ve ever had.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RgM0k9&via=Digg&text=Hacking The Powerball Lottery

div.div: The origins of Lost, as told by the people who made it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uaf35R&via=Digg&text='I Pretty Much Wanted To Die'

div.div: BASICALLY A MISSILE DEFENSE BOARD GAME

Wargame designer Paul Rohrbaugh has just created a board game based on the recent Israel-Hamas conflict. He is playtesting "A Reign of Missiles" to tweak the rules, and he wants your suggestions on how to improve it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SoOIm9&via=Digg&text=Launch Your Own Gaza War

div.a: 'Halo' Creator's New Game Details And Concept Art Leaked

div.div: Leaked materials provided to IGN by a reader have revealed story details and concept art from Destiny, Bungie’s follow-up to the Halo franchise.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tl9IXM&via=Digg&text='Halo' Creator's New Game Details And Concept Art Leaked

div.a: This Is The Iceberg That Sank The Titanic

div.div: One hundred years later, a photo that may the only surviving print showing that infamous chunk of ice is going up for auction. It’s expected to fetch up to $10,000.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SrXvC9&via=Digg&text=This Is The Iceberg That Sank The Titanic

div.div: The rare earths inside microcomputers make our lives easier. But just how toxic are the guts of your smartphone?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uw7t5X&via=Digg&text=Your Smartphone's Dirty, Radioactive Secret

div.a: Which U.S. State Would Win A Modern Civil War?

div.div: These are the accounts of the Second American Civil War, also known as the Wars of Reunification and the American Warring States Period.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10Q9wGj&via=Digg&text=Which U.S. State Would Win A Modern Civil War?

div.a: In These Games, Death Is Forever

div.div: In video games, we know that death is just temporary, that another life is just a magic mushroom away. But as games become more and more realistic, some designers are saying this relic from the arcade era has overstayed its welcome.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V3LHER&via=Digg&text=In These Games, Death Is Forever

div.a: The Place Where Teargas Is The New Oxygen

div.div: As you watch this video, remember that everyone involved in today’s clashes were willing to die for their cause, even the ignoble ones.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WXwWcW&via=Digg&text=The Place Where Teargas Is The New Oxygen

div.div: Mike Rosenthal collects and illustrates Twitter's funniest tweets.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S0QdoV&via=Digg&text=Twitter: The Comic

div.a: Brazilian Hidden Camera TV Show Stages The Most Horrifying Prank Ever

div.div: A Brazilian hidden camera show made sure no one in Brazil would ever enter an elevator alone again.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y0Rv9R&via=Digg&text=Brazilian Hidden Camera TV Show Stages The Most Horrifying Prank Ever

div.a: Turn Your iPhone Photos Into An 8-bit Video Game

div.div: 8bitCamera turns any photo into an 8-bit video game. It makes your photos crappy and cool at the same time!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T9cRuq&via=Digg&text=Turn Your iPhone Photos Into An 8-bit Video Game

div.a: A Collection Of Every Apple Television Ad Ever

div.div: Someone has gathered together what they say is ‘every Apple TV ad ever’ into one group and so many of them are worth watching.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WXvyXN&via=Digg&text=A Collection Of Every Apple Television Ad Ever

div.a: You're A Pussy If You Think There's A War On Men

div.div: he idea that feminism is harmful to men, and women have declared war on people with penises, isn’t confined to Reddit’s nether regions anymore. It’s now mainstream enough for Fox News’s website.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Spmnu9&via=Digg&text=You're A Pussy If You Think There's A War On Men

div.div: CAN A REVILED TROLL BECOME A GEEK HERO?

div.a: The Internet's Best Terrible Person Goes To Jail

div.div: There will always be terrible people, and out of all of the terrible people on the internet Auernheimer is one of the best. The pureness of his awfulness-for-awfulness' sake is something to marvel at.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vb2QlN&via=Digg&text=The Internet's Best Terrible Person Goes To Jail

div.a: Does The Universe Have A Purpose As Answered By Neil deGrasse Tyson

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VbXPtk&via=Digg&text=Does The Universe Have A Purpose As Answered By Neil deGrasse Tyson

div.div: TESTOSTERONE LEVELS IN MEN AT A SEX CLUB
A bunch of scientists basically went to a strip club and recruited patrons to participate in a study looking at how testosterone levels increased in men.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WtSOYs&via=Digg&text=Best Experiment Ever

div.a: The Psychological Sex Appeal Of Dark Personalities

div.div: For some reason, narcissists never seem to have trouble finding a willing mate. Psychology finally explains why.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10NJoMn&via=Digg&text=The Psychological Sex Appeal Of Dark Personalities

div.div: READING THIS STORY IS DEFINITELY WORTH IT

div.a: Is Picking A Penny Up Off The Ground Ever Worth It?

div.div: “If you carry a penny in your coin tray, how long would it take for that penny to cost you more than a cent in extra gas?”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/L5yyH1&via=Digg&text=Is Picking A Penny Up Off The Ground Ever Worth It?

div.div: LOOK AT THESE PEOPLE ARGUING WITH A ROBOT
An alarming amount of people are arguing with a Twitter bot that corrects their typos.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SojYS7&via=Digg&text=People Arguing With Typo-Correction Bot

div.a: Apple Said To Fire Maps Manager After Flaws Hurt iPhone 5

div.div: Apple Inc. (AAPL) has fired the manager responsible for its troubled mapping software, seeking to win back the trust of users disappointed after the program debuted in September, according to people familiar with the move.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uq2wNI&via=Digg&text=Apple Said To Fire Maps Manager After Flaws Hurt iPhone 5

div.a: The First Use Of 'OMG' Was In A 1917 Letter To Winston Churchill

div.div: Doesn't beat that time George Washington was all like, "King George III did what? SMH."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WtU9yd&via=Digg&text=The First Use Of 'OMG' Was In A 1917 Letter To Winston Churchill

div.a: Naked Protesters Storm Office Of Speaker Boehner

div.div: Some naked protesters stormed the Speaker of the House's office today.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V4t2c8&via=Digg&text=Naked Protesters Storm Office Of Speaker Boehner

div.div: If you want to understand Apple, watch this video.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SnRury&via=Digg&text=A Leaked Apple Store Video

div.a: When The Alabama A.G. Told The Head Of The KKK: 'Kiss My Ass'

div.div: This succinct note from Bill Baxley, Attorney General of Alabama in 1970, to the Grand Dragon of the KKK, is admirable in its brevity, forcefulness, and clarity.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SonDPN&via=Digg&text=When The Alabama A.G. Told The Head Of The KKK: 'Kiss My Ass'

div.div: Speed limits are the ultimate constraint on the roadways. Some places it's too low. Others, even though we thought it was impossible, are just way too high.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UU36lr&via=Digg&text=The Most Ridiculous Speed Limits

div.a: New York Cops Amassing A Trove Of Cellphone Logs

div.div: When a cellphone is reported stolen in New York, the Police Department routinely subpoenas the phone’s call records, from the day of the theft onward. But what happens to the records after that?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ThEd17&via=Digg&text=New York Cops Amassing A Trove Of Cellphone Logs

div.div: It's a match made in electronic academic heaven. JSTOR, the beloved digital scholarly journal archive usually available only to those affiliated with an educational institution, will now be available to top editors at Wikipedia.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S8SCy0&via=Digg&text=Wikipedia Announces Partnership With JSTOR

div.div: THERE'S SOMETHING THAT CAN'T BE GOOGLED?

div.a: How Google Plans To Find The UnGoogleable

div.div: Billions of Google searches are made every day—for all kinds of things—but we still look elsewhere for certain types of information, and the company wants to know what those things are.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sq0Ykx&via=Digg&text=How Google Plans To Find The UnGoogleable

div.a: Chinese Website Congratulates Kim Jong Un On Being Named The Onion's Sexiest Man Alive

div.div: China's Communist Party newspaper, People's Daily, congratulates the North Korean leader on being named the sexiest man alive by the the satirical American publication. Seriously.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U9oK4o&via=Digg&text=Chinese Website Congratulates Kim Jong Un On Being Named The Onion's Sexiest Man Alive

div.a: Google's Phantom Island May Have 19th-Century Roots

div.div: A Kiwi librarian may have discovered the origin of a nonexistent island that's been outfoxing cartographers for more than a century.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SpvviA&via=Digg&text=Google's Phantom Island May Have 19th-Century Roots
